tit.e: Kambun-inchi (document related to territory issued during Kanbun era)
tit.cmt: 併記された意味が下の内容説明と矛盾するので省きました。

sen.j: 寛文印知（かんぶんいんち）とは、寛文4年4月5日 (旧暦)（1664年4月30日）に江戸幕府が日本全国の大名に対して一斉に領知判物・朱印状・領知目録を交付した。
sen.e: Kanbun-inchi was a law including ryochi-hanmono (autographic signature for territory), shuinjo (shogunal license for foreign trade) and ryochi-mokuroku (list of territory) which was issued on April 5th, fourth year of the Kanbun era in the old calendar (April 30, 1664) to daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) throughout the country simultaneously by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: Wikipediaの同文で最後に「交付した法律。」となっていたので、付け加えて訳しました。時代ｶﾞタイトルに入っているので、旧暦もいれました。
sen.e: Kanbun-inchi was a law established through a series of documents, namely ryochi-hanmono (a shogunal letter of authorization for the possesion of and ruling over a fief), shuinjo (shogunal letters with a red seal) and ryochi-mokuroku (a document supplementing ryoci-hanmono indicating the details of a fief) which were simaltaneously issued by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) to daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) throughout the country on April 5, fourth year of the Kanbun era in the old calendar (April 30, 1664).
sen.cmt: 訳者のおっしゃる通り「法律」となっており、それ自体少し分かりにくい表現ですが（他のサイトでは書類の発行そのものを指す」となっています）、「発行された書類を持って確立された法律」というように修正しました。また「領知判物・領知目録」に関する補足説明は理解不可能と判断し修正しました。「朱印状」は研究社の和英辞典では確かに用語集のようになっていますが、全国の大名や公家に「外国貿易」を許すはずもなく、ここでは「花押のかわりに朱印を押した書状」という基本的解釈を採用しないと意味が通じないと思います。
sen.e: Kanbun-inchi was a law established through a series of documents, namely ryochi-hanmono (a shogunal letter of authorization for the possesion of and ruling over a fief), shuinjo (shogunal letters with a red seal) and ryochi-mokuroku (a document supplementing ryoci-hanmono indicating the details of a fief) which were simaltaneously issued by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) to daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) throughout the country on April 5, fourth year of the Kanbun era in the old calendar (April 30, 1664).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、翌寛文5年（1665年）には、公家・門跡・寺社などに対しても同様の措置が取られ、江戸幕府の大名領知権と日本全国の土地支配権を名実ともに確立した。
sen.e: Additionally, the same kind of measures were also taken for kuge (court noble), monzeki (successor of a temple), temples, shrines, and so on in the fifth year of the Kanbun era (in 1665) and accordingly, the Edo bakufu had established the right of daimyo domain and hegemony of the whole of Japan both in name and reality.

Similar documents were also issued to kuge (court noble), monzeki (successor of a temple), temples, shrines and so on in the following year, and accordingly, the Edo bakufu established each daimyu's right to possess and rule its fief and the right of prople and institutions to control individual territories both nominally and virtually.
sen.cmt: "measures taken for 誰それ"という言い方が成立するのか疑問があるので具体的な表現に変えました。あと全体的に修正しています。
sen.e: Similar documents were also issued to kuge (court noble), monzeki (successor of a temple), temples, shrines and so on in the following year, and accordingly, the Edo bakufu established each daimyu's right to possess and rule its fief and the right of prople and institutions to control individual territories both nominally and virtually.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 全国の大名・公家・寺社などが持っていた朱印状が一斉に回収・再交付された。
sen.e: Because all shuinjos owned by daimyo, kuge, temples and shrines in the country were recollected and reissued simultaneously, this event was called Kanbun-no-shuin-aratame (renewal of shuinjo during the Kanbun era), and such shuinjos were particularly called 'kanbun-no-shuinjo'.
Shuinjo which had been possessed till then by daimyo, kuge, temples and shrines throughout the country were returned first and new shuinjo were issued to them at the same time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処置をとりました。同時にrecollectなど不適切な訳語を修正しています。
sen.e: Shuinjo which had been possessed till then by daimyo, kuge, temples and shrines throughout the country were returned first and new shuinjo were issued to them at the same time.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そのため、これを特に寛文朱印改（かんぶんのしゅいんあらため）と呼び、これに基づいて交付された朱印状を特に「寛文朱印状」と呼ぶ。
sen.e: As a result, this event was called Kanbun-no-shuin-aratame (renewal of shuinjo in the Kanbun era), and the newly issued shuinjo were particularly called 'Kanbun-no-shuinjo'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処置をとりました。
sen.e: As a result, this event was called Kanbun-no-shuin-aratame (renewal of shuinjo in the Kanbun era), and the newly issued shuinjo were particularly called 'Kanbun-no-shuinjo'.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 従来は幕府から個々の領主に対して、領地判物・朱印状などの所領給付を示す文書を与えていたが、寛文4年3月7日 (旧暦)に全国の大名に対して一旦これを返納する事を命じた。
sen.e: Conventionally, bakufu had been issued documents in which bestowal of shoryo (territory) including ryochi-hanmono, shuinjo, and so on was described; however, bakufu ordered daimyo in the country to return the document temporarily on March 7 of the fourth year of the Kanbun era in the old calendar.

Documents cncerning the granting of fiefs, such as ryochi-hanmono and shuinjo, used to be issued to individual owners at different times, but the bakufu gave an order to all daimyo over the nation to return such documents to it, on March 7 (according to old lunar calendar), 1664.
sen.cmt: どの個所を修正というより、ほぼ全面的な書き換えです。
sen.e: Documents cncerning the granting of fiefs, such as ryochi-hanmono and shuinjo, used to be issued to individual owners at different times, but the bakufu gave an order to all daimyo over the nation to return such documents to it, on March 7 (according to old lunar calendar), 1664.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 続いて、4月5日付で全国の大名に対して同時に征夷大将軍徳川家綱の名義によって同一書式の領知判物・朱印状・領知目録を交付したのである。
sen.e: Subsequently, ryochi-hanmono, shuinjo and ryochi-mokuroku, which were written in the same format, were issued simultaneously to daimyos in the country under the name of Ietsuna TOKUGAWA, Seiitaishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians").

Subsequently, ryochi-hanmono, shuinjo and ryochi-mokuroku, written in the same format respectively, were issued simultaneously to daimyo throughout the country under the name of Ietsuna TOKUGAWA, Seiitaishogun (seiitaishogun: barbarian-quelling generalissimo).
sen.cmt: 3種の書類がすべて同一の書式ではないのでrespectivelyを補いました。征夷大将軍の訳語は（用語集では確かにこうなっていますが）研究社の和英辞典やBritannicaで左の訳語が使用されているので採用しました。
sen.e: Subsequently, ryochi-hanmono, shuinjo and ryochi-mokuroku, written in the same format respectively, were issued simultaneously to daimyo throughout the country under the name of Ietsuna TOKUGAWA, Seiitaishogun (seiitaishogun: barbarian-quelling generalissimo).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: なお、御三家とこれに準じる甲府徳川家及び館林徳川家、支藩の宇和島藩・伊予吉田藩の扱いについてまとまらなかったために後日交付となった仙台藩伊達氏を除いた219家に交付された。
sen.e: Incidentally, treatment for gosanke (three privileged branches), the Kofu-Tokugawa family and Tatebayashi family which had equivalent status of gosanke, and the branch domains of Uwajima Domain and Iyo-Yoshida Domain was not settled, accordingly, the document was issued to 219 families, except for the Date clan of Sendai Domain whom the document was issued later.
sen.cmt: Gosanke (three privileged branches of the Tokugawa family)
sen.e: These documents were issued to 219 families in total, excluding gosanke (御三家: three privileged branches of the Tokugawa family), the gosanke-equivalent Kofu Tokugawa and Tatebayashi Tokugawa families, and the Sendai Date clan for whom granting of the documents was put off to a later date because they did not agree to the way their two branch domains, Uwajima and Iyo Yoshida, were treated.
sen.cmt: 訳者は御三家から伊予吉田藩までのすべてについて扱いがまとまらなかったと解釈されたようですが、ここは「支藩の～仙台伊達氏」でくくるべきだと思います。
sen.e: These documents were issued to 219 families in total, excluding gosanke (御三家: three privileged branches of the Tokugawa family), the gosanke-equivalent Kofu Tokugawa and Tatebayashi Tokugawa families, and the Sendai Date clan for whom granting of the documents was put off to a later date because they did not agree to the way their two branch domains, Uwajima and Iyo Yoshida, were treated.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 続いて、寛文5年3月1日 (旧暦)に、公家・門跡・寺社に対しても同様の命令が出されて、同年の7月以後に順次新しい同一書式の領知判物・朱印状・領知目録を交付したのである。
sen.e: Subsequently, the same kind of order was also issued to kuge, monzeki, temples and shrines on March 1st in the fifth year of the Kanbun era in the old calendar, and ryochi-hanmono, shuinjo and ryochi-mokuroku, which were written in the same format, were issued from July in the same year.

Subsequently, a similar order for the return of documents was given to kuge, monzeki, temples and shrines on March 1 (old lunar calendar), 1665, and the new ryochi-hanmono, shuinjo and ryochi-mokuroku, each prepared in an identical format, were issued successively from July on in the same year.
sen.cmt: 「命令」の内容を補足しました。日付の表記を簡素化しました。「同一書式」の表現を修正しました。「順次」の訳を補足しました。
sen.e: Subsequently, a similar order for the return of documents was given to kuge, monzeki, temples and shrines on March 1 (old lunar calendar), 1665, and the new ryochi-hanmono, shuinjo and ryochi-mokuroku, each prepared in an identical format, were issued successively from July on in the same year.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: なお、公家と複数の徳川将軍から朱印状を受けた寺社及び50石以上の寺社領を持つ寺社に対しては個々に交付された。
sen.e: Incidentally, the document was respectively issued to kuge, several temples and shrines which had received shuinjo from Tokugawa Shogun, and temples and shrines with more than 500,000 koku of territory; for those temples and shrines which did not fit the above conditions, documents including shuinjo and so on were issued together to the head temples and shrines and so on of their religious school.

New ryochi-hanmono, shuinjo and ryochi-mokuroku were individually granted to kuge, those temples and shrines which had received shuinjo from more than one Tokugawa Shogun in the past or which possessed a territory of more than 500,000 koku (of rice).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処置をとりました。訳者は「複数の」を「寺社」にかけておられますが、ここは「複数の将軍から」と取るべきだと思います。
sen.e: New ryochi-hanmono, shuinjo and ryochi-mokuroku were individually granted to kuge, those temples and shrines which had received shuinjo from more than one Tokugawa Shogun in the past or which possessed a territory of more than 500,000 koku (of rice).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、これに当てはまらない寺社については、所属する宗派の本寺などに対して一括して朱印状などが与えられた。
sen.e: For those temples and shrines which do not fit the conditions mentioned above, however, the documents such as shuinjo were granted on a collective basis to their higher institution, for instance, the head temple of their religious school.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処置をとりました。
sen.e: For those temples and shrines which do not fit the conditions mentioned above, however, the documents such as shuinjo were granted on a collective basis to their higher institution, for instance, the head temple of their religious school.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これによって公家97家、門跡寺院27、比丘尼（尼寺）27、院家12、その他寺院1076、神社365、その他7に対して交付が行われた。
sen.e: By this, the documents were issued to 97 kuge, 27 monzeki temples, 27 bikuni (female Buddhist disciple), 12 inge (a branch temple to support services of the main temple), 1076 other temples, 365 shrines, and 7 others.

As a consequence, the documents were issued to 97 kuge, 27 monzeki temples, 27 convents, 12 inge (a branch temple to support services of the main temple), 1076 temples of other types, 365 shrines, and 7 others.
sen.cmt: By thisは少しmisleadingかと思い修正しました。
sen.e: As a consequence, the documents were issued to 97 kuge, 27 monzeki temples, 27 convents, 12 inge (a branch temple to support services of the main temple), 1076 temples of other types, 365 shrines, and 7 others.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 領知目録には、徳川将軍家が所領として与えた具体的な令制国郡村の名称とその石高について明記され、領主の領有する具体的な範囲が確定された。
sen.e: In the ryochi-mokuroku, name and kokudaka (stipend) of governed domains, counties and villages given by the Tokugawa Shogun family as shoryo had been specifically described, accordingly, territories of feudal lords were determined concretely.
sen.cmt: 石高について意訳併記しました。
sen.e: In the ryochi-mokuroku were specified the name of the provinces (as governed in accordance with the ritsuryo codes) including their counties and villages, and their kokudaka (stipend assessed in terms of rice production), granted by the Tokugawa Shogun family, thus concretely determining the range of a territory for each manorial head.
sen.cmt: どの個所を修正というより、ほぼ全面的な書き換えです。
sen.e: In the ryochi-mokuroku were specified the name of the provinces (as governed in accordance with the ritsuryo codes) including their counties and villages, and their kokudaka (stipend assessed in terms of rice production), granted by the Tokugawa Shogun family, thus concretely determining the range of a territory for each manorial head.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、江戸幕府による領知判物・朱印状・領知目録の書式と書札礼は以後これを定型とした。
sen.e: Additionally, ryochi-mokuroku, shuinjo, and format and shosatsurei (remarks on the concept of epistolary etiquette) of ryochi-mokuroku which were used at that time by the Edo bakufu were determined to be a fixed form afterward.

The format and shosatsurei (letter-writing rules and etiquette) applied to ryochi-hanmono, shuinjo and ryochi-mokuroku issued thereafter by the Edo bakufu were standardized using those of the ones issued in 1664.
sen.cmt: 原訳は意味不明です。また「領知目録・朱印状・領知目録」と部分の最初の「領知目録」は「領知判物」の間違いだと思われます。原則としては「原文通りに訳してコメントを」ということですが、あまりにもおかしな訳文になってしまうので訂正しました。
sen.e: The format and shosatsurei (letter-writing rules and etiquette) applied to ryochi-hanmono, shuinjo and ryochi-mokuroku issued thereafter by the Edo bakufu were standardized using those of the ones issued in 1664.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: なお、実際に奉行としてこれを行ったのは、大名領担当は小笠原長矩・永井尚庸、公家領担当は稲葉正則、寺社領担当は井上正利・加々爪直澄、符案及び訂正は久保正之（右筆支配）であった。
sen.e: Incidently, bugyo (magistrate, shogunate administrator) actually conducted this project were those who Naganori OGASAWARA and Naotsune NAGAI who were in charge of daimyo domain, Masanori INABA in charge of territory of kuge, Masatoshi INOUE and Naozumi KAGATSUME in charge of territory of temples and shrines, and Masayuki 久保 in charge of design and amendment of a tally (yuhitsu [amanuensis]).
sen.cmt: 久保は[読み方不明」です。（左の注は氏名が分かれているので調べましたが、「ひさやす」と呼ぶのか分かりませんでした。）
sen.e: People engaged in practical business of issuing those documents as bugyo (magistrate, shogunate administrator) included Naganori OGASAWARA and Naotsune NAGAI, who covered the domains of daimyo, Masanori INABA, the territories of kuge, Masatoshi INOUE and Naozumi KAGATSUME, the territories of temples and shrines, and Masayuki KUBO (yuhitsu [amanuensis]) who was in charge of document drafting and amending.
sen.cmt: 文法上の誤りを訂正するとともに後半部分の改善を試みました。「久保（正之）」の読みについて訳者の指摘どおり参考訳としてあげられた「ひさやす」が正しいのか、通常の読みである「くぼ」でいいのか確証がありません。「符案」：続群書類従完成会（日本史の史料集の刊行で定評、但しすでに倒産）出版の資料に「【東寺造営文書符案】中世の東寺造営に関する公文書の案文集」とあり信頼に足る説明だと思われます。これから考えるとdesignよりもdraftingのほうがよさそうです。「右筆支配」：支配が意味不明です。印象としてはmanagerかと思いますが、確証がなく、単に「右筆」の訳を加えています。
sen.e: People engaged in practical business of issuing those documents as bugyo (magistrate, shogunate administrator) included Naganori OGASAWARA and Naotsune NAGAI, who covered the domains of daimyo, Masanori INABA, the territories of kuge, Masatoshi INOUE and Naozumi KAGATSUME, the territories of temples and shrines, and Masayuki KUBO (yuhitsu [amanuensis]) who was in charge of document drafting and amending.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 一連の交付によって発給された領知判物・朱印状・領知目録の総数は1830通に及ぶ。
sen.e: The total number of a series of issuance of ryochi-hanmono, shuinjo and ryochi-mokuroku was reached to 1830.
The total number of ryochi-hanmono, shuinjo and ryochi-mokuroku issued reached 1830.
sen.cmt: 文法的誤りの修正です。
sen.e: The total number of ryochi-hanmono, shuinjo and ryochi-mokuroku issued reached 1830.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 後にこれらの内容は『寛文印知集』（『寛文印知留』など諸本によって名称は異なる）と呼ばれた記録集にまとめられた。
sen.e: Later, these contents were summarized in a record called "Kanbun-inchi-syu" (the title is different according to a record, such as "寛文印知留").
sen.cmt: 寛文印知留の読み方不明です。
sen.e: The contents of these documents were later compiled into a documentary literature called "Kanbun-inchi-shu" (or under some different names including "Kanbun-inchi-dome").
sen.cmt: 留：「御用留」という通達や命令の記録集ものがあり、「ごようどめ」と読むそうです。よって「Kanbun-inchi-dome]としました。
sen.e: The contents of these documents were later compiled into a documentary literature called "Kanbun-inchi-shu" (or under some different names including "Kanbun-inchi-dome").
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これは作成年代・編者は不明であるが、江戸幕府の全国統治の基本資料として、多くの写本・異本が作成されている。
sen.e: Although it is not clear who and when these records were made, many manuscripts and alternative versions were made as fundamental documents for national administration of the Edo bakufu.

It is not known when or by whom Kanbun-inchi-shu was compiled, and there exist a number of manuscripts and alternative versions of this literature, which work as the basic documents showing how the Edo bakufu administered the nation in those days.
sen.cmt: どの個所を修正というより、ほぼ全面的な書き換えです。
sen.e: It is not known when or by whom Kanbun-inchi-shu was compiled, and there exist a number of manuscripts and alternative versions of this literature, which work as the basic documents showing how the Edo bakufu administered the nation in those days.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、これによって同時期の全国の大名の配置と石高がほぼ把握出来るために、日本史 (科目)の教科書などでは、これに基づいて作成された大名の配置図が採用される事が多い。
sen.e: At the same time, thanks to these records, outline of domains and kokudaka (a system for determining land value for tribute purposes in the Edo period) of daimyos in the country in those days can be figured out, map of daimyos' disposition which was made based on this record is often adopted for textbooks of Japanese history.

Also, Kanbun-inchi-shu shows the then distribution of daimyo and each daimyo's kokudaka throughout the country almost completely, and the daimyo distribution map based on this literature is often used in school textbooks on Japanese history.
sen.cmt: どの個所を修正というより、ほぼ全面的な書き換えです。
sen.e: Also, Kanbun-inchi-shu shows the then distribution of daimyo and each daimyo's kokudaka throughout the country almost completely, and the daimyo distribution map based on this literature is often used in school textbooks on Japanese history.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 貞享元年（1684年）に徳川綱吉が将軍を継ぐと、寛文印知の対象外であった小規模寺社を含めて朱印状などの再交付（継目安堵）を行い、大名・公家・寺社他4878通が交付された。
sen.e: When Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA succeeded the shogunate in 1684, shuinjo and so on were issued again to 4878 of daimyos, kuge, temples and shrines and so on including small-scale temples and shrines which had not been covered by kanbun-inchi (tsugime ando [joint recognition and guarantee, by the shogunate, of ownership of the inherited estate of a samurai who pledged allegiance to it]); these re-issuance became a custom when there was a change of shoguns after Yoshimune TOKUGAWA shogunate.

When Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA became the fifth shogun in 1684, a total of 4,878 documents including shuinjo was regranted to daimyo, kuge, temples and shrines including small-scale temples and shrines which had not been covered by Kanbun-inchi, which was called tugime-ando (tsugime: inheritance, ando: recognition and guarantee by the lord of a vassal's rights regarding a piece of land or an estate, tsugime-ando [only referring to ones carried out in the Edo period]: renewal of such recognition and gurantee by each shogun]).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処置をとりました。「継目安堵」についてかなり詳細な説明を付けましたが、江戸時代になってこの言葉の意味が大きく変わっているため必要と考えました。
sen.e: When Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA became the fifth shogun in 1684, a total of 4,878 documents including shuinjo was regranted to daimyo, kuge, temples and shrines including small-scale temples and shrines which had not been covered by Kanbun-inchi, which was called tugime-ando (tsugime: inheritance, ando: recognition and guarantee by the lord of a vassal's rights regarding a piece of land or an estate, tsugime-ando [only referring to ones carried out in the Edo period]: renewal of such recognition and gurantee by each shogun]).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 徳川吉宗以後将軍の交替ごとに同じように継目安堵が行われる事となった。
sen.e: This tsugime-ando came to be carried out at each shogunal succession from the eighth shogun Yoshimune TOKUGAWA and thereafter.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処置をとりました。
